t: Psalm 74
Prayer for Israel
A Maskil of Asaph.
Why*pn have you rejected us forever, God? Why*ln does your anger burn against*ln the sheep of your pasture?
Remember*ln your congregation, which*ln you purchased long ago and*ln redeemed as the tribe for your own possession. Remember*ln Mount Zion where you dwell.
Make*ln your way to the perpetual ruins, to*ln all that the enemy has destroyed in the sanctuary.
Your*ln adversaries roared in the meeting place where*ln you met with us. They*ln set up their emblems as signs.
It*ln was like men in a thicket of trees, wielding*ln axes,
then*ln smashing all the carvings with*ln hatchets and picks.
They*ln set your sanctuary on fire; they*ln utterly desecrated the*ln dwelling place of your name.
They*ln said in their hearts, “Let’s*ln oppress them relentlessly.” They*ln burned every place throughout the land where*ln God met with us.
There*ln are no signs for us to see. There*ln is no longer a prophet. And*ln none of us knows how long this will last.
God,*ln how long will the enemy mock? Will*ln the foe insult your name forever?
Why*ln do you hold back your hand? Stretch*ln out your right hand and destroy them!
God*pn my King is from ancient times, performing*ln saving acts on the earth.
You*ln divided the sea with your strength; you*ln smashed the heads of the sea monsters in the water;
you*ln crushed the heads of Leviathan; you*ln fed him to the creatures of the desert.
You*ln opened up springs and streams; you*ln dried up ever-flowing rivers.
The*ln day is yours, also the night; you*ln established the moon and the sun.
You*ln set all the boundaries of the earth; you*ln made summer and winter.
Remember*pn this: the enemy has mocked the Lord,*s and*ln a foolish people has insulted your name.
Do*ln not give to beasts the life of your dove; do*ln not forget the lives of your poor people forever.
Consider*ln the covenant, for*ln the dark places of the land are full of violence.
Do*ln not let the oppressed turn away in shame; let*ln the poor and needy praise your name.
Rise*ln up, God, champion your cause! Remember*ln the insults that*ln fools bring against you all day long.
Do*ln not forget the clamor of your adversaries, the*ln tumult of your opponents that goes up constantly.
